verses.text: And Ahab told Jezebel all that Elijah had done , and withal how he had slain all the prophets with the sword.
Then Jezebel sent a messenger unto Elijah , saying , So let the gods do \add to me\add*, and more also, if I make not thy life as the life of one of them by to morrow about this time.
And when he saw \add that\add*, he arose , and went for his life , and came to Beer-sheba , which \add belongeth\add* to Judah , and left his servant there. \p

¶ But he himself went a day’s journey into the wilderness , and came and sat down under a juniper tree : and he requested for himself that he might die ; and said , It is enough ; now, O \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, take away my life ; for I \add am\add* not better than my fathers.\f + \fr 19.4 \ft for himself: Heb. for his life\f*
And as he lay and slept under a juniper tree , behold, then an angel touched him, and said unto him, Arise \add and\add* eat.

And he looked , and, behold, \add there was\add* a cake baken on the coals , and a cruse of water at his head. And he did eat and drink , and laid him down again.\f + \fr 19.6 \ft head: Heb. bolster\f*
And the angel of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* came again the second time , and touched him, and said , Arise \add and\add* eat ; because the journey \add is\add* too great for thee.
And he arose , and did eat and drink , and went in the strength of that meat forty days and forty nights unto Horeb the mount of God. \p
¶ And he came thither unto a cave , and lodged there; and, behold, the word of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add came\add* to him, and he said unto him, What doest thou here, Elijah ?

And he said , I have been very jealous for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of hosts : for the children of Israel have forsaken thy covenant , thrown down thine altars , and slain thy prophets with the sword ; and I, \add even\add* I only, am left ; and they seek my life , to take it away.

And he said , Go forth , and stand upon the mount before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. And, behold, the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* passed by , and a great and strong wind rent the mountains , and brake in pieces the rocks before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*; \add but\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add was\add* not in the wind : and after the wind an earthquake ; \add but\add* the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* \add was\add* not in the earthquake :
And after the earthquake a fire ; \add but\add* the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add was\add* not in the fire : and after the fire a still small voice.

And it was \add so\add*, when Elijah heard \add it\add*, that he wrapped his face in his mantle , and went out , and stood in the entering in of the cave. And, behold, \add there came\add* a voice unto him, and said , What doest thou here, Elijah ?

And he said , I have been very jealous for the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* God of hosts : because the children of Israel have forsaken thy covenant , thrown down thine altars , and slain thy prophets with the sword ; and I, \add even\add* I only, am left ; and they seek my life , to take it away.
And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto him, Go , return on thy way to the wilderness of Damascus : and when thou comest , anoint Hazael \add to be\add* king over Syria :

And Jehu the son of Nimshi shalt thou anoint \add to be\add* king over Israel : and Elisha the son of Shaphat of Abel-meholah shalt thou anoint \add to be\add* prophet in thy room.\f + \fr 19.16 \ft Elisha: Gr. Eliseus\f*
And it shall come to pass, \add that\add* him that escapeth the sword of Hazael shall Jehu slay : and him that escapeth from the sword of Jehu shall Elisha slay.
Yet I have left \add me\add* seven thousand in Israel , all the knees which have not bowed unto Baal , and every mouth which hath not kissed him.\f + \fr 19.18 \ft I have…: or, I will leave\f* \p

¶ So he departed thence, and found Elisha the son of Shaphat , who \add was\add* plowing \add with\add* twelve yoke \add of oxen\add* before him, and he with the twelfth : and Elijah passed by him, and cast his mantle upon him.

And he left the oxen , and ran after Elijah , and said , Let me, I pray thee, kiss my father and my mother , and \add then\add* I will follow thee. And he said unto him, Go back again : for what have I done to thee?\f + \fr 19.20 \ft Go…: Heb. Go return\f*

And he returned back from him , and took a yoke of oxen , and slew them, and boiled their flesh with the instruments of the oxen , and gave unto the people , and they did eat. Then he arose , and went after Elijah , and ministered unto him.
